events.title: Galileo discovers the Galilean moons of Jupiter
events.description: Galileo Galilei observes four moons—Io, Europa, Ganymede, and Callisto—around Jupiter using a telescope, marking the first known observations of moons orbiting another planet.
events.significance: A landmark in astronomy that expanded understanding of the solar system and provided crucial evidence supporting heliocentrism.

events.title: Electoral College votes to elect George Washington as the first U.S. president
events.description: In the first U.S. presidential election, electors met and cast their votes, resulting in George Washington being unanimously elected as the first President of the United States.
events.significance: Established the precedent for the U.S. presidency and the peaceful transfer of power under a new constitutional framework.

events.title: Daguerre announces the daguerreotype, first practical photograph
events.description: Louis Daguerre publicly reveals the daguerreotype process (developed with Niépce), inaugurating the era of practical photography.
events.significance: Birth of modern photography, transforming visual culture, documentation, and communication.
